text:
It would be helpful to have an option for the Host valve
that would send a permanent redirect when a request matches a host
alias.

This is useful to help search engines etc that apache.org would redirect
to www.apache.org so making it clear that they are the same entity.

Since this seems like a common requirement and the alias is already defined
in server.xml so tidy to implement it in the container.

NB Seems pretty safe for GETs to redirect using the original path and query
string. Im not sure about POSTs might be more problematic.
creator: sam@redspr.com
yoavs@computer.org
text:
As the lack of activity on this issue shows, interest is low, and I don't think
it's a "common requirement." Please feel free to submit a patch if you feel like
it: we'll gladly look at it and commit if it makes sense.
